tr.td: PT WILL NEED DRUG SCREEN AND PILL COUNT PRIOR TO REFILL OF ALPRAZOLAM

td.content: 1. Multiple complications due to type 2 diabetes mellitus

tr.td: Patient is a type 2 diabetic. Last fasting labs was performed on 2023-09-17. HgA1C was 5.8, and random albumin was 9.0. Will recheck all labs on or around 2023-12-20. Current medications being taken are metformin 1000 mg p.o. b.i.d., Ozempic 1 mg subQ weekly, gabapentin 800 mg q.i.d. for diabetic neuropathy. Will remain on current medication regimen. Patients vision exam is not up to date-Erwin Eye Care. Patients last monofilament exam was 2023-02-20. Pt is on a statin. Patient has been counseled in dietary changes and exercise.
• Ozempic 1 mg/dose (4 mg/3 mL) subcutaneous pen injector
Patient has a BMI of 35.1. Todays weight is 185.1, which is a 2 pound increase since last visit. Current medication: phentermine 37.5 mg 1/2 po bid

DEXA 2022-05-14 shows osteopenia with increased fracture risk. Continue alendronate at present. Obtain bone health consult. Administer calcium with K2 to avoid deposition in the coronary arteries. Reassessment of vitamin-D at next lab draw-previously low, 2022-12-03 was 29.3
• calcium-vitamin D3-vitamin K 500 mg-200 unit-40 mcg chewable tablet

Patient reports at this time she is doing well on Alprazolam 0.25 mg twice daily. She continues having anxiety over smoking cessation, recent move, and wound healing. She is treated for her bipolar by mental health, and also takes Vilazodone 40mg q am for depression. Patient is due for compliance UDS in order to refill Alprazolam. She is unable to urinate and did not bring medication for pill count. Discussed with patient that medication cannot be refilled until she returns for UDS.
Will require lifelong oral anticoagulation, continue Eliquis 5 mg twice daily
• taking direct oral anticoagulants safely: care instructions

Patient with known hyperlipidemia. Last lipid panel on 2023-04-09 improved. Patient continues on pravastatin 40 mg daily. Lifestyle modifications discussed including weight loss, aerobic exercise at least 30 min/day at least 5 days per week, and a diet rich in fruit and vegetables. Goal LDL: <100mg/dL, <70mg/dL. Will continue to follow lipid panel q6-12 months.

Patient was to have Neurology evaluation by Dr. Hasegawa 2023-10-08, but she had to reschedule. She says that she rescheduled for 2023-11-24 and has now rescheduled again. Patient currently takes topiramate 100 mg p.o. t.i.d but says that this does not help some days. She has tried ubrelvy in the past and states that she had good success with this medicine. Will prescribe Ubrelvy for patient to take at onset of migraine. Discussed increase of fluids as dehydration can cause increase in migraines.

Patients blood pressure today was 138/90. Last EKG date was 2023-03-08. Last date for UA was 2023-09-17 and CMP was 2023-09-17. Creatinine was 1.19 and had trace of protein in urine. Labs will need to be obtained again on or around 2023-12-20. Patient is currently on Metoprolol 25 mg twice daily and Losartan 50 mg daily for hypertension. Will discuss maintaining medication, and exercise and diet habits.

Pain and neuropathy to the legs are the patient's biggest complaints. following significant MVC in 2011 with multiple surgeries patient has had chronic pain and neuropathy.
2023-01-03 stressed that smoking cessation must occur before Dr. Fogleman, WOPA will perform ankle revision.
2023-04-27 orthopedics was put off for several months secondary to GI bleed. I have emphasized to the patient that we need to focus on making her the best surgical candidate possible: Control her blood pressure, blood sugar, weight, and have quit smoking.
2023-08-19- Patient is no longer eligible for pain management through this clinic. Offered to send patient to pain management but she has been released from several different ones in this area. Will continue with Gabapentin. Patient may follow-up with orthopedic as planned.
2023-11-19- Patient has a white string protruding from scar on right ankle from prior surgery- No signs of infection. Patient will need to see Dr. Fogleman at WOPA for further evaluation. She reports that she will call and make this appointment.

Patient advised risks / benefits of controlled substance, other available options. Offered prescription for naloxone- yes

Patient is a smoker, 1 ppd. Patient us O2 3L/min NC hs and prn.. Meds- Spiriva, Anoro, Daliresp, p.r.n. albuterol.
Pulmonologist- seen 2023-01-30. Pulmonary does approve patient for surgery. Takes Eliquis 5 mg p.o. b.i.d. for history DVT/PE.
• Anoro Ellipta 62.5 mcg-25 mcg/actuation powder for inhalation
Takes aripiprazole 15 mg q.a.m. and lamotrigine 150 b.i.d. for bipolar by Jill Newton, MH
Prior B12 deficiency. Will recheck today

text.content: 60 year old female here for medical management of chronic health problems and medication refills.

tr.td: Ears: no ear pain. Nose: no sinus problems. Mouth/Throat: no sore throat, no ringing in the ears, no sinusitis
Cardiovascular: no chest pain, no arm pain on exertion, no ankle swelling
Gastrointestinal: no abdominal pain, no nausea, no vomiting, no constipation, no diarrhea, not vomiting blood
Genitourinary: no incontinence, no difficulty urinating, no hematuria, no increased frequency
Skin: no jaundice; "string coming out of right inner ankle"
Neurologic: no dizziness, no headaches, no tremor, no gait dysfunction
Psych: no alcohol abuse, no hallucinations, no suicidal thoughts
Allergy/Immunologic: no runny nose, no sinus pressure, no itching

General Appearance overweight/obese; 60-year-old female, BP 138/90, HR 106 BMI 35.1 Ambulates with cane. HEENT: JVP < 6. Lungs: ; breath sounds are coarse, no cough. Cardio: s1 normal, s2 normal, no murmurs. Abdomen: soft, non tender, non distended, normal bowel sounds; positive bowel sounds. Extremities: pulses 2+, ankle edema bilateral, , +, 1 bilateral, , +, 1 bilateral, , +, 1 bilateral, , +, 1; patient has some swelling and tenderness to the left knee, but no effusion and no instability. Patient has 1+ edema to left lower extremity, trace to the right lower extremity. Chronic surgical changes Patient has small white string protruding from scar from prior ankle surgery- No signs of infection. Neurologic: no visual disturbances, no confusion
